epsnCrickinfoSidebars.description: A day out at the Hundred through the eyes of a 12-year-old fan
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content1: Alex Davies and Ross Whiteley orchestrated a remarkable turnaround as Southern Brave secured a six-wicket win to keep their slim qualification hopes alive heading into the closing rounds of the group stage
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content2: Brave won the toss and elected to bowl on what turned out to be an extremely difficult wicket to bat on. For long stretches of the chase, Dawid Malan's innings 59 off 41 for Trent Rockets seeming likely to be the difference between the sides.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content3: At the halfway point, Rockets' total of 138 for 6 was believed to be slightly under par, with allrounder Samit Patel wary in his optimism that it was defendable, even if he did speak with the knowing look of a player who had seen these types of pitches before and knew that a good start could see the game could turn quickly.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content4: But three consecutive sets of five then went for double figures, as Rockets' afterburners ran out, Brave aided by a series of wides and no-balls as the bowlers struggled with a wet ball. The result was 66 off 30 became 23 off 15 as Brave stole victory in the blink of an eye.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content5: Alex Davies and Ross Whiteley orchestrated a remarkable turnaround as Southern Brave secured a six-wicket win to keep their slim qualification hopes alive heading into the closing rounds of the group stage
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content6: Malan became the first person in the competition to reach 300 runs as he scored his third half-century. The left-hander is the leading run-scorer in the Hundred this season, and a bonus for England ahead of the T20 World Cup - particularly with Jason Roy so out of form.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content7: The innings wasn't chanceless with Malan gaining a life on 37 when he skied a Sonny Baker delivery to point where Michael Hogan put down a relatively simple catch. Despite Baker being 22 years junior to Hogan, he still managed to master the disappointed fatherly stare.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content8: That Rockets were in a position to let victory slip from their hands was the result of their own fantastic seam bowling at the start of Brave's innings.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content9: Spin was expected to lead proceedings with the wicket sticking and pace-off proving hard to time. But Luke Wood, Daniel Sams and Sam Cook were able to exploit the conditions superbly as Brave managed just 15 runs from the first 25 balls.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content10: Such was the dominance of seam that allrounder and captain Lewis Gregory, who is yet to bowl his full allocation in a match this season, brought himself on as a fourth seamer before turning to either of his experienced spinners in Tabraiz Shamsi and Samit Patel. Gregory's 15 balls would go for just 14 runs as Rockets' eased themselves seemingly into an unassailable position.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.heading3: Davies and Whiteley graft, David ices chase
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content11: Brave struggled to 52 for 2 at halfway and looked dead and buried when 71 were needed off the final 35 balls. Davies had just struck his first boundary, from his 30th ball faced, and Whiteley was new to the crease with six off seven.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content12: Rockets' position seemed only to be getting stronger, but the turning point came when, with 55 required off 25 balls, Sams bowled an eight-ball set that went for 19 runs and included a wide and two no-balls (one of which was for a fielding infringement). Shamsi's following set went for 13 as a game that had been all but over for Brave became theirs to lose.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content13: Whiteley departed for a vital 30 off 21 balls with 16 needed off 11, but any doubts over the result of the match were put to bed when Tim David struck consecutive sixes to send a raucous Southern Brave crowd home happy.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.title: On This Day: India's first Test win in England

The left-hander is the leading run-scorer in the Hundred this season, and a bonus for England ahead of the T20 World Cup - particularly with Jason Roy so out of form.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content7: The innings wasn't chanceless with Malan gaining a life on 37 when he skied a Sonny Baker delivery to point where Michael Hogan put down a relatively simple catch. Despite Baker being 22 years junior to Hogan, he still managed to master the disappointed fatherly stare.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content8: That Rockets were in a position to let victory slip from their hands was the result of their own fantastic seam bowling at the start of Brave's innings.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content9: Spin was expected to lead proceedings with the wicket sticking and pace-off proving hard to time. But Luke Wood, Daniel Sams and Sam Cook were able to exploit the conditions superbly as Brave managed just 15 runs from the first 25 balls.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content10: Such was the dominance of seam that allrounder and captain Lewis Gregory, who is yet to bowl his full allocation in a match this season, brought himself on as a fourth seamer before turning to either of his experienced spinners in Tabraiz Shamsi and Samit Patel. Gregory's 15 balls would go for just 14 runs as Rockets' eased themselves seemingly into an unassailable position.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.heading3: Davies and Whiteley graft, David ices chase
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content11: Brave struggled to 52 for 2 at halfway and looked dead and buried when 71 were needed off the final 35 balls. Davies had just struck his first boundary, from his 30th ball faced, and Whiteley was new to the crease with six off seven.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content12: Rockets' position seemed only to be getting stronger, but the turning point came when, with 55 required off 25 balls, Sams bowled an eight-ball set that went for 19 runs and included a wide and two no-balls (one of which was for a fielding infringement). Shamsi's following set went for 13 as a game that had been all but over for Brave became theirs to lose.
epsnCrickinfoSidebars.content13: Whiteley departed for a vital 30 off 21 balls with 16 needed off 11, but any doubts over the result of the match were put to bed when Tim David struck consecutive sixes to send a raucous Southern Brave crowd home happy.

espncricinfoDataFeatures.content11: Brave struggled to 52 for 2 at halfway and looked dead and buried when 71 were needed off the final 35 balls. Davies had just struck his first boundary, from his 30th ball faced, and Whiteley was new to the crease with six off seven.
espncricinfoDataFeatures.content12: Rockets' position seemed only to be getting stronger, but the turning point came when, with 55 required off 25 balls, Sams bowled an eight-ball set that went for 19 runs and included a wide and two no-balls (one of which was for a fielding infringement). Shamsi's following set went for 13 as a game that had been all but over for Brave became theirs to lose.
espncricinfoDataFeatures.content13: Whiteley departed for a vital 30 off 21 balls with 16 needed off 11, but any doubts over the result of the match were put to bed when Tim David struck consecutive sixes to send a raucous Southern Brave crowd home happy.

epsnCrickInfo.description: A day out at the Hundred through the eyes of a 12-year-old fan
epsnCrickInfo.content1: Alex Davies and Ross Whiteley orchestrated a remarkable turnaround as Southern Brave secured a six-wicket win to keep their slim qualification hopes alive heading into the closing rounds of the group stage
epsnCrickInfo.content2: Brave won the toss and elected to bowl on what turned out to be an extremely difficult wicket to bat on. For long stretches of the chase, Dawid Malan's innings 59 off 41 for Trent Rockets seeming likely to be the difference between the sides.
epsnCrickInfo.content3: At the halfway point, Rockets' total of 138 for 6 was believed to be slightly under par, with allrounder Samit Patel wary in his optimism that it was defendable, even if he did speak with the knowing look of a player who had seen these types of pitches before and knew that a good start could see the game could turn quickly.
epsnCrickInfo.content4: But three consecutive sets of five then went for double figures, as Rockets' afterburners ran out, Brave aided by a series of wides and no-balls as the bowlers struggled with a wet ball. The result was 66 off 30 became 23 off 15 as Brave stole victory in the blink of an eye.
epsnCrickInfo.content5: Alex Davies and Ross Whiteley orchestrated a remarkable turnaround as Southern Brave secured a six-wicket win to keep their slim qualification hopes alive heading into the closing rounds of the group stage
epsnCrickInfo.content6: Malan became the first person in the competition to reach 300 runs as he scored his third half-century. The left-hander is the leading run-scorer in the Hundred this season, and a bonus for England ahead of the T20 World Cup - particularly with Jason Roy so out of form.
epsnCrickInfo.content7: The innings wasn't chanceless with Malan gaining a life on 37 when he skied a Sonny Baker delivery to point where Michael Hogan put down a relatively simple catch. Despite Baker being 22 years junior to Hogan, he still managed to master the disappointed fatherly stare.
epsnCrickInfo.content8: That Rockets were in a position to let victory slip from their hands was the result of their own fantastic seam bowling at the start of Brave's innings.
epsnCrickInfo.content9: Spin was expected to lead proceedings with the wicket sticking and pace-off proving hard to time. But Luke Wood, Daniel Sams and Sam Cook were able to exploit the conditions superbly as Brave managed just 15 runs from the first 25 balls.
epsnCrickInfo.content10: Such was the dominance of seam that allrounder and captain Lewis Gregory, who is yet to bowl his full allocation in a match this season, brought himself on as a fourth seamer before turning to either of his experienced spinners in Tabraiz Shamsi and Samit Patel. Gregory's 15 balls would go for just 14 runs as Rockets' eased themselves seemingly into an unassailable position.
epsnCrickInfo.heading3: Davies and Whiteley graft, David ices chase
epsnCrickInfo.content11: Brave struggled to 52 for 2 at halfway and looked dead and buried when 71 were needed off the final 35 balls. Davies had just struck his first boundary, from his 30th ball faced, and Whiteley was new to the crease with six off seven.
epsnCrickInfo.content12: Rockets' position seemed only to be getting stronger, but the turning point came when, with 55 required off 25 balls, Sams bowled an eight-ball set that went for 19 runs and included a wide and two no-balls (one of which was for a fielding infringement). Shamsi's following set went for 13 as a game that had been all but over for Brave became theirs to lose.
epsnCrickInfo.content13: Whiteley departed for a vital 30 off 21 balls with 16 needed off 11, but any doubts over the result of the match were put to bed when Tim David struck consecutive sixes to send a raucous Southern Brave crowd home happy.
epsnCrickInfo.heading: On This Day: India's first Test win in England

epsnCrickInfo.content5: Alex Davies and Ross Whiteley orchestrated a remarkable turnaround as Southern Brave secured a six-wicket win to keep their slim qualification hopes alive heading into the closing rounds of the group stage
epsnCrickInfo.content6: Malan became the first person in the competition to reach 300 runs as he scored his third half-century. The left-hander is the leading run-scorer in the Hundred this season, and a bonus for England ahead of the T20 World Cup - particularly with Jason Roy so out of form.
epsnCrickInfo.content7: The innings wasn't chanceless with Malan gaining a life on 37 when he skied a Sonny Baker delivery to point where Michael Hogan put down a relatively simple catch. Despite Baker being 22 years junior to Hogan, he still managed to master the disappointed fatherly stare.
epsnCrickInfo.content8: That Rockets were in a position to let victory slip from their hands was the result of their own fantastic seam bowling at the start of Brave's innings.
epsnCrickInfo.content9: Spin was expected to lead proceedings with the wicket sticking and pace-off proving hard to time. But Luke Wood, Daniel Sams and Sam Cook were able to exploit the conditions superbly as Brave managed just 15 runs from the first 25 balls.
epsnCrickInfo.content10: Such was the dominance of seam that allrounder and captain Lewis Gregory, who is yet to bowl his full allocation in a match this season, brought himself on as a fourth seamer before turning to either of his experienced spinners in Tabraiz Shamsi and Samit Patel. Gregory's 15 balls would go for just 14 runs as Rockets' eased themselves seemingly into an unassailable position.
epsnCrickInfo.heading3: Davies and Whiteley graft, David ices chase
epsnCrickInfo.content11: Brave struggled to 52 for 2 at halfway and looked dead and buried when 71 were needed off the final 35 balls. Davies had just struck his first boundary, from his 30th ball faced, and Whiteley was new to the crease with six off seven.
epsnCrickInfo.content12: Rockets' position seemed only to be getting stronger, but the turning point came when, with 55 required off 25 balls, Sams bowled an eight-ball set that went for 19 runs and included a wide and two no-balls (one of which was for a fielding infringement). Shamsi's following set went for 13 as a game that had been all but over for Brave became theirs to lose.
epsnCrickInfo.content13: Whiteley departed for a vital 30 off 21 balls with 16 needed off 11, but any doubts over the result of the match were put to bed when Tim David struck consecutive sixes to send a raucous Southern Brave crowd home happy.

epsnCrickInfo.content10: Such was the dominance of seam that allrounder and captain Lewis Gregory, who is yet to bowl his full allocation in a match this season, brought himself on as a fourth seamer before turning to either of his experienced spinners in Tabraiz Shamsi and Samit Patel. epsnCrickInfo.content11: Brave struggled to 52 for 2 at halfway and looked dead and buried when 71 were needed off the final 35 balls. Davies had just struck his first boundary, from his 30th ball faced, and Whiteley was new to the crease with six off seven.

epsnCrickInfo.heading: Bell, Wellington share seven wickets as dominant Southern Brave roll Rockets
epsnCrickInfo.description: Smriti Mandhana, Danni Wyatt stroll in chase as Brave make it five from five
epsnCrickInfo.content1: Alex Davies and Ross Whiteley orchestrated a remarkable turnaround as Southern Brave secured a six-wicket win to keep their slim qualification hopes alive heading into the closing rounds of the group stage
epsnCrickInfo.content2: Brave won the toss and elected to bowl on what turned out to be an extremely difficult wicket to bat on. For long stretches of the chase, Dawid Malan's innings 59 off 41 for Trent Rockets seeming likely to be the difference between the sides.
epsnCrickInfo.content3: At the halfway point, Rockets' total of 138 for 6 was believed to be slightly under par, with allrounder Samit Patel wary in his optimism that it was defendable, even if he did speak with the knowing look of a player who had seen these types of pitches before and knew that a good start could see the game could turn quickly.
epsnCrickInfo.content4: But three consecutive sets of five then went for double figures, as Rockets' afterburners ran out, Brave aided by a series of wides and no-balls as the bowlers struggled with a wet ball. The result was 66 off 30 became 23 off 15 as Brave stole victory in the blink of an eye.
epsnCrickInfo.content5: Alex Davies and Ross Whiteley orchestrated a remarkable turnaround as Southern Brave secured a six-wicket win to keep their slim qualification hopes alive heading into the closing rounds of the group stage
epsnCrickInfo.content6: Malan became the first person in the competition to reach 300 runs as he scored his third half-century. The left-hander is the leading run-scorer in the Hundred this season, and a bonus for England ahead of the T20 World Cup - particularly with Jason Roy so out of form.
epsnCrickInfo.content7: The innings wasn't chanceless with Malan gaining a life on 37 when he skied a Sonny Baker delivery to point where Michael Hogan put down a relatively simple catch. Despite Baker being 22 years junior to Hogan, he still managed to master the disappointed fatherly stare.
epsnCrickInfo.content8: That Rockets were in a position to let victory slip from their hands was the result of their own fantastic seam bowling at the start of Brave's innings.
epsnCrickInfo.content9: Spin was expected to lead proceedings with the wicket sticking and pace-off proving hard to time. But Luke Wood, Daniel Sams and Sam Cook were able to exploit the conditions superbly as Brave managed just 15 runs from the first 25 balls.
epsnCrickInfo.content10: Such was the dominance of seam that allrounder and captain Lewis Gregory, who is yet to bowl his full allocation in a match this season, brought himself on as a fourth seamer before turning to either of his experienced spinners in Tabraiz Shamsi and Samit Patel. Gregory's 15 balls would go for just 14 runs as Rockets' eased themselves seemingly into an unassailable position.

epsnCrickInfo.content3: At the halfway point, Rockets' total of 138 for 6 was believed to be slightly under par, with allrounder Samit Patel wary in his optimism that it was defendable, even if he did speak with the knowing look of a player who had seen these types of pitches before and knew that a good start could see the game could turn quickly.
epsnCrickInfo.content4: But three consecutive sets of five then went for double figures, as Rockets' afterburners ran out, Brave aided by a series of wides and no-balls as the bowlers struggled with a wet ball. The result was 66 off 30 became 23 off 15 as Brave stole victory in the blink of an eye.
epsnCrickInfo.content5: Alex Davies and Ross Whiteley orchestrated a remarkable turnaround as Southern Brave secured a six-wicket win to keep their slim qualification hopes alive heading into the closing rounds of the group stage
epsnCrickInfo.content6: Malan became the first person in the competition to reach 300 runs as he scored his third half-century. The left-hander is the leading run-scorer in the Hundred this season, and a bonus for England ahead of the T20 World Cup - particularly with Jason Roy so out of form.
epsnCrickInfo.content7: The innings wasn't chanceless with Malan gaining a life on 37 when he skied a Sonny Baker delivery to point where Michael Hogan put down a relatively simple catch. Despite Baker being 22 years junior to Hogan, he still managed to master the disappointed fatherly stare.
epsnCrickInfo.content8: That Rockets were in a position to let victory slip from their hands was the result of their own fantastic seam bowling at the start of Brave's innings.
epsnCrickInfo.content9: Spin was expected to lead proceedings with the wicket sticking and pace-off proving hard to time. But Luke Wood, Daniel Sams and Sam Cook were able to exploit the conditions superbly as Brave managed just 15 runs from the first 25 balls.
epsnCrickInfo.content10: Such was the dominance of seam that allrounder and captain Lewis Gregory, who is yet to bowl his full allocation in a match this season, brought himself on as a fourth seamer before turning to either of his experienced spinners in Tabraiz Shamsi and Samit Patel. Gregory's 15 balls would go for just 14 runs as Rockets' eased themselves seemingly into an unassailable position.
epsnCrickInfo.heading3: Davies and Whiteley graft, David ices chase
epsnCrickInfo.content11: Brave struggled to 52 for 2 at halfway and looked dead and buried when 71 were needed off the final 35 balls. Davies had just struck his first boundary, from his 30th ball faced, and Whiteley was new to the crease with six off seven.
epsnCrickInfo.content12: Rockets' position seemed only to be getting stronger, but the turning point came when, with 55 required off 25 balls, Sams bowled an eight-ball set that went for 19 runs and included a wide and two no-balls (one of which was for a fielding infringement). Shamsi's following set went for 13 as a game that had been all but over for Brave became theirs to lose.
epsnCrickInfo.content13: Whiteley departed for a vital 30 off 21 balls with 16 needed off 11, but any doubts over the result of the match were put to bed when Tim David struck consecutive sixes to send a raucous Southern Brave crowd home happy.

epsnCrickInfo.content7: The innings wasn't chanceless with Malan gaining a life on 37 when he skied a Sonny Baker delivery to point where Michael Hogan put down a relatively simple catch. Despite Baker being 22 years junior to Hogan, he still managed to master the disappointed fatherly stare.
epsnCrickInfo.content8: That Rockets were in a position to let victory slip from their hands was the result of their own fantastic seam bowling at the start of Brave's innings.
epsnCrickInfo.content9: Spin was expected to lead proceedings with the wicket sticking and pace-off proving hard to time. But Luke Wood, Daniel Sams and Sam Cook were able to exploit the conditions superbly as Brave managed just 15 runs from the first 25 balls.
epsnCrickInfo.content10: Such was the dominance of seam that allrounder and captain Lewis Gregory, who is yet to bowl his full allocation in a match this season, brought himself on as a fourth seamer before turning to either of his experienced spinners in Tabraiz Shamsi and Samit Patel. Gregory's 15 balls would go for just 14 runs as Rockets' eased themselves seemingly into an unassailable position.
epsnCrickInfo.heading3: Davies and Whiteley graft, David ices chase
epsnCrickInfo.content11: Brave struggled to 52 for 2 at halfway and looked dead and buried when 71 were needed off the final 35 balls. Davies had just struck his first boundary, from his 30th ball faced, and Whiteley was new to the crease with six off seven.
epsnCrickInfo.content12: Rockets' position seemed only to be getting stronger, but the turning point came when, with 55 required off 25 balls, Sams bowled an eight-ball set that went for 19 runs and included a wide and two no-balls (one of which was for a fielding infringement). Shamsi's following set went for 13 as a game that had been all but over for Brave became theirs to lose.
epsnCrickInfo.content13: Whiteley departed for a vital 30 off 21 balls with 16 needed off 11, but any doubts over the result of the match were put to bed when Tim David struck consecutive sixes to send a raucous Southern Brave crowd home happy.

epsnCrickInfo.content11: Brave struggled to 52 for 2 at halfway and looked dead and buried when 71 were needed off the final 35 balls. Davies had just struck his first boundary, from his 30th ball faced, and Whiteley was new to the crease with six off seven.
epsnCrickInfo.content12: Rockets' position seemed only to be getting stronger, but the turning point came when, with 55 required off 25 balls, Sams bowled an eight-ball set that went for 19 runs and included a wide and two no-balls (one of which was for a fielding infringement). Shamsi's following set went for 13 as a game that had been all but over for Brave became theirs to lose.
epsnCrickInfo.content13: Whiteley departed for a vital 30 off 21 balls with 16 needed off 11, but any doubts over the result of the match were put to bed when Tim David struck consecutive sixes to send a raucous Southern Brave crowd home happy.

epsnCrickInfo.heading: Runorder: Captaincy merry-go-round the new normal for India?
epsnCrickInfo.description: Dale Steyn and Wasim Jaffer join the Runorder crew to ponder about India's rotating captains
epsnCrickInfo.content1: Alex Davies and Ross Whiteley orchestrated a remarkable turnaround as Southern Brave secured a six-wicket win to keep their slim qualification hopes alive heading into the closing rounds of the group stage
epsnCrickInfo.content2: Brave won the toss and elected to bowl on what turned out to be an extremely difficult wicket to bat on. For long stretches of the chase, Dawid Malan's innings 59 off 41 for Trent Rockets seeming likely to be the difference between the sides.
epsnCrickInfo.content3: At the halfway point, Rockets' total of 138 for 6 was believed to be slightly under par, with allrounder Samit Patel wary in his optimism that it was defendable, even if he did speak with the knowing look of a player who had seen these types of pitches before and knew that a good start could see the game could turn quickly.
epsnCrickInfo.content4: But three consecutive sets of five then went for double figures, as Rockets' afterburners ran out, Brave aided by a series of wides and no-balls as the bowlers struggled with a wet ball. The result was 66 off 30 became 23 off 15 as Brave stole victory in the blink of an eye.
epsnCrickInfo.content5: Alex Davies and Ross Whiteley orchestrated a remarkable turnaround as Southern Brave secured a six-wicket win to keep their slim qualification hopes alive heading into the closing rounds of the group stage
epsnCrickInfo.content6: Malan became the first person in the competition to reach 300 runs as he scored his third half-century. The left-hander is the leading run-scorer in the Hundred this season, and a bonus for England ahead of the T20 World Cup - particularly with Jason Roy so out of form.
epsnCrickInfo.content7: The innings wasn't chanceless with Malan gaining a life on 37 when he skied a Sonny Baker delivery to point where Michael Hogan put down a relatively simple catch. Despite Baker being 22 years junior to Hogan, he still managed to master the disappointed fatherly stare.
epsnCrickInfo.content8: That Rockets were in a position to let victory slip from their hands was the result of their own fantastic seam bowling at the start of Brave's innings.
epsnCrickInfo.content9: Spin was expected to lead proceedings with the wicket sticking and pace-off proving hard to time. But Luke Wood, Daniel Sams and Sam Cook were able to exploit the conditions superbly as Brave managed just 15 runs from the first 25 balls.
epsnCrickInfo.content10: Such was the dominance of seam that allrounder and captain Lewis Gregory, who is yet to bowl his full allocation in a match this season, brought himself on as a fourth seamer before turning to either of his experienced spinners in Tabraiz Shamsi and Samit Patel. Gregory's 15 balls would go for just 14 runs as Rockets' eased themselves seemingly into an unassailable position.
